intro: Arctotis scariosa, commonly known as the silverleaf arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its showy flowers are typically pink to red, with a yellow center, and bloom during the warmer months. It is well-suited for rock gardens and dry climates due to its drought tolerance.
